text:
The stairs creak beneath your weight, each step echoing like a chime in some lost cathedral. The northern passage rises toward a crumbled keep. Statues line the path—knights and priests, heads bowed or broken. Their features have eroded away, but their postures are pleading.

Snow begins to fall—not of ice, but of ash. The wind hums with distant hymns, half-remembered. At the top, a sealed door stands adorned with chains and crimson wax. You feel something behind it pulse—not in hatred, but in waiting.
lore: The northern stair once led to the Shattered Keep, home of the Chainlord and his bound choir. It was said none who entered the upper sanctum ever descended again. Some believe they sang until silence claimed them.
